meanings.definition: Form an opinion about (someone or something) before having enough information to be sure about it.
meanings.sent1: She always forejudges people based on their appearance.
meanings.sent2: He forejudges the outcome of the game before it even starts.
meanings.sent3: The cat forejudges the new toy as a potential threat.
meanings.sent4: The teacher forejudges the student's abilities before giving them a chance to prove themselves.
meanings.sent5: Forejudging can lead to misunderstandings and missed opportunities.

meanings.sent1: They forejudges the weather forecast and decided to bring an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: She forejudges the quality of the book based on its cover.
meanings.sent3: The team forejudges the opponent's strategy and plans their own moves accordingly.
meanings.sent4: He forejudges the risks involved and takes necessary precautions.
meanings.sent5: Forejudging can sometimes save time but may also lead to hasty decisions.
